results.title: Whitefellanormal
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Vernon Ah Kee
results.brief_description: Vernon Ah Kee’s seething representation of contemporary Australian black/white politics playfully uses language, moving text and self-portraiture to deadly serious effect.

results.title: White zombie
results.creator_credit: Edward C. Halperin and Victor Halperin
results.brief_description: In this eerie, theatrically staged horror film, a young couple, Madeleine Short (Madge Bellamy) and Neil Parker (John Harron) encounter the world of voodoo and zombies in the Haitian mountains when they arrive as guests of Charles Beaumont (Robert Fraser). When their host enlists the evil powers of Muder Legende (Bela Lugosi) to place a curse on Madeleine, a series of chilling events occur.

results.title: White sails in Danish waters
results.creator_credit: Nordisk Films Kompagni, Paul Bang and Carl Otto Peterson
results.brief_description: Shows yachting in Danish waters. Tells how children and young people receive skilled instruction in the yacht clubs. We join a holiday cruise through some of Denmark’s loveliest regions, and experience a race on the sound.

results.title: White safari
results.creator_credit: Hugh Wallace, Sydney Newman and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Canada carries on”.
This is an abridged version of the film Exercise Musk-ox. It describes a three-month journey of scientific exploration through Canada’s north. Members of the Canadian Army, with snowmobiles and amphibious weasel, made a great winter trek over country never before travelled by motor vehicle. The expedition took detailed weather observations, corrected maps, studied the mobility of snow vehicles, and coped with the weather. Through human skill and endurance the frontier of the north was pushed back, showing its rich promise for the future. Voice and narration: Lorne Greene.

results.title: White nights
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Delphi V Productions, New Visions Pictures, William S. Gilmore and Taylor Hackford
results.brief_description: This Cold War thriller stars real-life dancer Mikhail Baryshnikov as a Russian defector who finds himself trapped in his homeland when his plane crashes in Siberia. Billeted with an American dancer (Gregory Hines), Kolya is desperate to escape and hatches a daring plan but must evade the keen attentions of the KGB. Whilst the plot is fair to middling, the dancing in this feature film is brilliant, making the most of the two lead’s spectacular talents. Also stars Helen Mirren and Isabella Rossellini.

results.title: White manure
results.creator_credit: Films Division, Government of India, M. Bhavnani and Mohan Wadhwani
results.brief_description: Shows Sindri (India), which has the largest chemical fertilizer factory in Asia. The plan and the technical processes of the factory are shows, and tis significance for Indian agriculture is underlined.

results.title: White man's country
results.creator_credit: Anthony-David Productions, Films Incorporated, Anthony Howarth and David Kopp
results.brief_description: This is a well-documented film which deals with British Colonialism in Kenya from an African viewpoint. This film works as an expose of colonialists, and can be used to study them, or as part of an African history course.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anthony-David Productions, Films Incorporated, Anthony Howarth and David Kopp

results.title: White hunter: black heart
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Clint Eastwood
results.brief_description: One of Clint Eastwood’s most engaging films, “White hunter, black heart” is based on Peter Vietel’s novel about the location shoot of John Huston’s immortal “The African Queen”. The focus, however, is never on Bogie and Hepburn, but rather on the obsessive director who is determined to turn his new film project into a grand personal quest, hunting a wild elephant. Cast includes Clint Eastwood, Jeff Fahey, George Dzundza, Alun Armstrong and Marisa Berenson.
